medical_history.chief_complaint: A 20-year-old man was admitted due to sore throat, fever, and a diffuse rash.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately 4 weeks earlier with sore throat. The patient had a normal temperature initially but experienced a recurrence of sore throat and fever one week before admission. After starting treatment with amoxicillin-clavulanate, a rash developed on the medial surface of the right arm, which progressed over 3 days to painful, raised, enlarged lesions covering most of his body. The patient reported odynophagia for solid foods, mild fatigue, swollen lymph nodes, and loose stools lasting approximately 4 days.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of allergic rhinitis, childhood otitis media treated with amoxicillin-clavulanate, fractures of the right ankle and leg, and allergy to cephalosporins causing a rash. He had varicella in childhood.
medical_history.family_history: Father and paternal grandfather had prostate cancer; no family history of dermatologic disorders or melanoma.
medical_history.social_history: The patient is a student living with roommates in an urban apartment, observed mice in the building, recently went golfing and to the beach more than 2 months ago, not hiking, no known contact with ill persons, no recent travel, and not using intravenous drugs. He consumes beer on weekends.
